article: She described a situation where her son while _ attack, was with his comrades moving toward their objective. _ , he stepped over a mine . He was fortunate, however, his friend was not so _ . The impact was immediate--his _ was more severe than anything he could describe. All he knew was that he was in a different place, wondering to himself, "Is this what _ feels like?" The next thing he _ was hearing a slight groan coming from nearby. Looking over his _ he noticed it was his friend, _ on the ground. It seemed at the time as though lower half of his body was missing. "Am I still _ ?" he thought, rubbing his eyes, checking with every sense he could _ . Yes, it is my partner, then sudden reflexes kicked in. Getting up quickly, he made his way to what he now _ was only a bad dream. Unfortunately, his friend was _ ; it was not a dream. As he bent over to help, he knew he was his friend's only _ .This dying soldier needed his full _ . His legs were gone; blood was rushing out of his body everywhere. It would be only minutes, maybe seconds and his _ would be over. Grabbing anything he could find that could be used as a bandage, he _ stopped the bleeding. After waiting for the gunfire to _ . he picked his friend up off the ground and carried him off to _ . I ask you, "Who gives more when it comes to _ our country?" The brave men and women who are willingly giving the final sacrifice . We _ those who serve our country. We pray for their safety and well-being. We know with certainty, it is our freedoms they protect.
